title: Riot with us at live events!

Dont know about you but i enjoy some of these, not all, some are complete spam, but some are good
{{champion:238}} +{{item:3023}} ={{champion:56}}
And of course the East coast gets no love again. GG Riot, gg.
We some love in here! It's starting to get kind of dusty!
or midwest..
Or anywhere outside of Southern California for that matter.
Toronto, Southern California is one of my favourite places.
Hawaii and Alaska never get love from anything :( except tourists.
I'm from Alaska, and have always wanted to bring some League of Legends back home. Unfortunately, there aren't any shows (that I know of) that would make sense for us to go to. :(

Canada, the Southern United States and the East Coast in general are all areas we want to hit more meaningfully next year. Trust me, many Rioters (myself included) are East coast transfers. We intimately understand the frustration of missing out on things like Prime, Blizzcon and many other amazing con experiences due to financial constraints or simple geographic proximity.

This year we hit up PAX East in Boston, Momocon in Atlanta and are still slated to revisit Atlanta for Dragoncon and Toronto for Fan Expo. While that's technically 4 cons on or near the East Coast, you're right in that it still doesn't provide an easily accessible con for everyone and our work is far from done.

With all that said I think this is an extremely valuable conversation to have and the feedback is very welcome. One of the things that makes the League of Legends community unique is how passionate we all our when it comes to meeting in real life to celebrate the game. Whether it be at a Con, an LCS viewing party, as a member of a collegiate club or even participating in a tournament, finding ways to offer these experiences in some shape or form to every player in North America is something we're always working towards.  

- Rom
South? <3

FFS riot. Only attending events on earth? Give mars some love please.

You all should hold an event in lexington,ky. Albiet its a small convention But KentokyoCon is having it's second convention and it would bolster the league community here in ky. Iam not a streamer or some diamond/plat/contender player, iam just your average joe on league, and I want the others in the community to be able to enjoy riot events a bit closer to home, since alot of us are college/high school students or work to much to travel or just can't afford it. Please consider KentokyoCon as a venue.
